comments:
After a hard crash of my computer (worse than a blue screen...) and a reboot, all my editors in Eclipse show the following error:

"Unable to create this part due to an internal error. Reason for the failure: Editor could not be initialized."

and the stacktrace/error log shows the following exception:

eclipse.buildId=M20060629-1905
java.version=1.5.0_07
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Framework arguments:  - clean
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 - clean

Error

(class: org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/ast/NameReference, method: <init> signature: ()V) Illegal type in constant pool

On restarting Eclipse, Clean all projects and rebuild everything is back to normal.

I would expect Eclipse to be able to recover immediately, but since it requires only another Workspace restart it is very minor - but perhaps there is a cache or something similar that should be cleaned up on restart?

Last time I have seen it it was due to corrupted class files.
If you can provide steps to reproduce (beside the hard crash) it would be nice.
Closing as WORKSFORME. Please reopen if you get it again and you can reproduce it.

traces.message: (class: org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/ast/NameReference, method: <init> signature: ()V) Illegal type in constant pool
